oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Columbia Female Institute
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Woodcut print of the exterior of the Columbia Female Institute. Several people are outside of the building.

The Columbia Female Institute, designed and constructed in 1837 by architects Messrs. Drummond & Lutterloh, served as an Episcopal all-girls school. It was owned and operated by the Episcopal Church of Tennessee. The school officially opened in 1838.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Croome, William, 1790-1860; Bowen, Abel, 1790-1850
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Women--Education; Women--Education--History; Education--Tennessee
